We need to:
- do an HTML mockup for LOCOG approval
Then:
- change the player js (theming.js?) on the home page so it doesn't load the video just shows the player.
- change the player js (theming.js?) so that a light box is opened when the large image is clicked
- change the player so that the full size video is available to the lightbox
See mock up attached..

cool, this looks good. What do you think makes the most sense in terms of functionality?  Do you think it'd be strange to click on the 'bigger' image of the video in the switcher and then have this open, and then click on the play button for it to work?  Too many steps?

Thanks Liz,

I think we need the bigger video thumb (or video) to appear first, we can't go straight from the small thumb straight to a pop up.

The simplest would be to make video work like the Webcams, where when you click on the main/larger thumbnail you go to the actual video/webcam page.

Although the video is way to small to watch at the current size, I like the idea of selecting a video, see it play a bit and then deciding it's too small and expanding it, closing it and then maybe selecting another video to play in situ. (or in a bigger pop up).

We could make the small video appear but have an overlay or icon (that always appears or just you roll over the video) that says 'click here to view video full size'.

In terms of Javascript, the video won't even load without Javascript turned on. I *think* we currently show a message saying you need Flash and Javascript to view this video.

Before we go any further I think we need to decide:

- Do we show a real video at the small size or do we just display a click-able image (I prefer the small video I think as it shows you it's video)
- Do we then show the larger video in a pop-up or just take the user though to the relevant video page (a pop up allows the user to watch multiple videos without leaving the home page)

Jamie

- Do we show a real video at the small size or do we just display a
click-able image (I prefer the small video I think as it shows you it's
video) 

Small video and then a 'view full size' button that's Super obvious. 

- Do we then show the larger video in a pop-up or just take the
user though to the relevant video page (a pop up allows the user to
watch multiple videos without leaving the home page) 

Pop up!

Do you think we can feasibly fit the 'full size' link somewhere obvious
in the switcher? It would be fine to have a similar link for
webcams...but have the webcams link just say, 'see all webcams' that
took you to the webcam hub page.

comments.value:
Previously, translated pages were placed into the appropriate section after they came back from translation based on the translated section name. This meant that inadvertent differences in section translation led to pages gong astray. Now, the section is known in advance and there is no possibility of the page going into the wrong section.

The other driving factor behind this refactoring is that it removes a level of abstraction. Until now we (effectively) had a "translations" table which showed which page had been translated when. However, now this information all lives in the french page's workflow (see attached).
This work will take an estimated 5 days to complete.
Morag asks: "is it safe to actually say the refactoring is somewhat done, but not front-end?"

This ticket is part of the French site launch: http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/438, which is due on February 28. Therefore I have changed the due date for this to Feb 28 (although I believe the this work is already done). Not billable because being billed as part of the site launch.
This ticket was closed and merged into ticket #438 "French site handover".

subject: Refactoring of translation
description:
Previously, translated pages were placed into the appropriate section after they came back from translation based on the translated section name. This meant that inadvertent differences in section translation led to pages gong astray. Now, the section is known in advance and there is no possibility of the page going into the wrong section.

The other driving factor behind this refactoring is that it removes a level of abstraction. Until now we (effectively) had a "translations" table which showed which page had been translated when. However, now this information all lives in the french page's workflow (see attached).

This is intended to be similar to the Flash feature we had on our 1000 days to go splash page, in which a number of photos with quotes on top appear. Photos and quotes will be edited by separate files.

Cogapp have produced this feature and the assets are attached. Is it possible to implement this on the Inspire hub page (but not push it live - I need to amend some of the files).

Thank you!
Forgot to say, you can see the slider in action here on the Cogapp project site: http://projects.cogapp.com/clients/LOCOG/html/flash_page2.html

Morag,

This page actually uses a template shared by lots of other pages and I assume you only want the flash on this page.
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/inspire-programme/index.php

Would you be OK with us creating a new page that we swap out for the existign one (you'll need to reassign things like promos, but guess your going to do that anyway?)

Hi Jamie, yes, that is absolutely fine - thanks!

 

________________________________

Lars can you pick this up, 

I have so far:

1) Created a new inspire hub page / template (this needs to be swapped for the current hub page once Morag is ready to go live and the hide from nav box unticked)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/inspire-programme/inspire-hub.php

2) I have created a '/flash' folder in 
/get-involved/inspire-programme/

3) This contains the bits that 2012 need to edit (flash/images folderand the flash/xml folder)

4) But I have uploaded the other files direct to the live server (web01) via FTP because:
   a) the contain underscores (which the CMS converts to underscores  on publication)
   b) the names are in camel caps (which the CMS flattens on publication)
   c) it's hard to upload deeply nested folders to the CMS

[** we should as BigButton/CogApp not to supply code like this in future and use lowercase names without underscores, in shallowly nested folders]

5) I have also added the CSS to the main.css 

6) I have also added the JS to load the flash header to the new Inspire hub template and modified it to fit the new paths / the live site.

*BUT* (STILL TO DO  / FIX !!)

1) The movie isn't showing - expect it's path issue?
2) The replacement (no flash) image has a black line round it messing up layout.
3) [*important*] LOCOG need to edit /flash/xml/textcopy.xml (which will be published out lowercase) but the slider is looking for a camel caps version (so you will need to update the Flash file)
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/get-involved/inspire-programme/flash/xml/textcopy.xml

Have a look at the original email / attachment for instructions.

Can you test that it is working and that you can edit the XML file in the CMS *before* closing this ticket.

It will only work when published due to the JS assets not living in the CMS (seems to dangerous to convert all paths to lowercase with no underscores)

Can you keep track on what you do on this also think about feed back we can give to 3rd party that will streamline this sort of this in future, I will then add it to the 'CMS best practice' doc which Morag can then send onto agencies.

thanks

Jamie

[Lars read previous post]

But Morag,

We have notice something that will become a problem.

The file you need to edit is called textCopy.xml but when we publish this out of the CMS it wil be flattened to textcopy.xml (lowercase c) and so will never be picked up.

Would you be able to get the flash movie resupplied so it looks for textcopy.xml (not textCopy.xml)

Hope this isn't too inconvenient..

(if you don't need to update the slider thsi won't be a issue)

Jamie

The Flash movie needs to be pick up a XML file called textcopy.xml (not textCopy.xml)

thanks

Jamie

Morag
